result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward A. Schwartz

defendant.name: Schwartz, Edward A.

records.addlTxt: Covers cases 21CM109 and 22CM15.
Covers cases 21CM109 and 22CM15.

9:06 AM Defendant Edward A. Schwartz not in court.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Edward A. Schwartz.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   Cases 22CM15 and 21CM109.  Letter in file from forensic unit that def has been non compliant to scheduled evaluation.  Atty, expected def to appear in person, Atty to try and get a hold of.  Back on the record at 9:25.  Atty tried calling number and didn't know where def is.  State is asking for warrant and ff of bond if no appearance.  Court orders warrant in each case, BOW, ff of bond, send notice, if no response in 30 days judgment will enter.
to Ct from WFU- Dr. Seifert Lynch re:  unable to contact defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:13 AM Defendant Edward A. Schwartz in court.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Edward A. Schwartz.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 21CM109 and 22CM15.  Atty does not have a phone number for def, going into break out room with Atty.  Back on the record at 9:40.  Atty raising issue of competency.  Court reviewed the complaints, as to each case finds probable cause that def has committed a crime/s in Ashland County.  Court orders def to be examined in each case for competency.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
